title: Protesters Pour Onto Hong Kong Streets as Government Set to Impose Face Mask Ban
text:
Hundreds of protesters marched on the streets of Hong Kong on October 4 as reports said a proposed ban on face masks at public assemblies could come in to force at midnight.

Since March, Hong Kong has experienced mass protests sparked by a now-shelved extradition bill that would have allowed people to be sent to mainland China for trial. The protests have broadened, with hundreds of thousands participating in multiple rallies.

On October 1, a protester was shot in the chest at point blank range by a police officer, during a day of violent protests to mark China’s National Day. Credit: Galileo Cheng via Storyful

The protests have broadened, with hundreds of thousands participating in multiple rallies.
